subanswer.text: The sum of angles ABD and FDB is given by the fact that they form a linear pair with angle ABD (angles on a straight line add up to 180°). Thus, their sum is $180^\circ - \angle ABF = 180^\circ - (180^\circ/3 - 60^\circ) = 180^\circ - 120^\circ + 60^\circ = \boxed{60^\circ}$. The answer is 60°.

The measure of angle AFD is then $\angle AFD = \angle ADF + \angle DFE = 180^\circ - (\angle ADB + \angle BDE) = 180^\circ - (60^\circ + 40^\circ) = \boxed{80^\circ}$. The answer is 80°.
